text: Conditions have continued to deteriorate since 2017. We demand that these blatant violations of people's rights cease immediately and that those who feel their rights have been violated are adequately compensated. (2/2)

🔴Italy violates the rights of people on the run. This is confirmed not only by NGOs but also by the European Court of Human Rights itself. The conditions at the Lampedusa hotspot constitute "inhuman and degrading treatment." (1/2) https://t.co/5qNpQ0wflu

We continue to fight for freedom of movement and the right of asylum for all and demand legal and safe escape routes. With the #SeaWatch5, we are setting a humanitarian example. Support the rebuilding & our work with your donation: https://t.co/O1c1HnPAEh https://t.co/d0rpAjl1Q5

140 people were intercepted in the Mediterranean.
We watched today how the so-called Libyan Coast Guard intercepted three boats in distress. During one of these interceptions, several people fell overboard without life jackets. Fortunately, it seems that all of them survived. https://t.co/1YsAVAsLs9

Urgently wanted: Able Seafarers and Deckhands for all our ships. Get active and support our work on the #SeaWatch3, #SeaWatch5, and #Aurora. Starting from now for the upcoming months. To join our crew, please apply via our website: https://t.co/cToGGoNnb9 https://t.co/Ek5Xv7IPnC

Consequences of the new decree-law regulating civil sea rescue under Giorgia Meloni are immediately visible. We demand the immediate release of the @MVLouiseMichel & a policy that prevents dying in the Mediterranean instead of accepting more deaths out of political calculation!

The demands on the Italian Coast Guard can hardly be overlooked. Yet, it is not an argument for the many people dying off the Italian coast. Instead of involving civil sea rescue ships in rescue operations, the Italian government blocks available sea rescue ships. https://t.co/yewFdQXBGA

The situation in the #Mediterranean is chaotic. Thousands of people have arrived on Lampedusa in recent weeks, some in entirely unseaworthy boats, bodies are still being recovered from the shipwreck off Crotone, and at least 29 people lost their lives off Tunisia at the weekend. https://t.co/coUjf0OVS5

Will the @EU_Commission now finally ensure that technical, logistical and training support is stopped?

The civil fleet in the central Mediterranean rescues people who are leaving their homes in the hope of a life of freedom in Europe. With the #SeaWatch5, we can be there again soon. Support the reconstruction and our work with your donation: https://t.co/KCT9x1YHrU https://t.co/OwqNktPhc0

These are crimes that the #EU has known about for years. Yet it continues the policy of intercepting and returning people to #Libya. In doing so, the EU is aiding and abetting serious crimes, says the #UN. (5/5) https://t.co/Yleb8THsgx

In detention centers under the control of the so-called Libyan Coast Guard and other Libyan security forces, people are tortured, extorted, raped, and murdered. Others are sold like slaves and sexually exploited - a #CrimeAgainstHumanity. (4/5)

The #EU's support to the so-called Libyan Coast Guard makes illegal interceptions and pullbacks to #Libya possible in the first place. It is a clear violation of the principle of the non-refoulment principle. Libya is not safe & people face severe human rights violations. (3/5)

In its final report, the @UN Fact-Finding Mission on #Libya concludes "that Libyan security forces and armed militias committed a high number of #WarCrimes and #CrimesAgainstHumanity."  (2/5) https://t.co/GxCNPFoFJ7

The #EU empowers the so-called Libyan Coast Guard to hinder people on the move from reaching Europe. According to #UN Fact-Finding Mission, EU member states are thus complicit in the worst abuses in #Libya. (1/5) https://t.co/CupYSDqORf

Those who rescue are now punished by Italy with 20 days of detention. While bodies wash up on Italian shores, civil sea rescue ships are blocked. This Italian decree will lead to even more deaths in the Mediterranean. In solidarity with the @MVLouiseMichel! https://t.co/OAFxbIBDtF

Countless people fleeing in distress at sea, shots fired by the so-called Libyan Coast Guard and the detention of @MVLouiseMichel by Italian authorities.

Jakob, member of our #Seabird crew, about the past weekend in the central Mediterranean: https://t.co/wEEXNyTdVe

Those who rescue get detained.
After saving 180 lives in the Mediterranean in the last few days, the @MVLouiseMichel was detained by Italian authorities.
Reason: the crew should have gone straight to a port after the first rescue & ignored other distress calls. https://t.co/oeMIxRuRdJ

With further gunfire and life-threatening maneuvers, the sc. Libyan Coast Guard attempted to stop the boat, with one person falling into the water. All people were dragged back to Libya. Violence and a breach of international law - commissioned and paid for by the EU.

In international waters, the so-called Libyan Coast Guard threatened the crew of the Ocean Viking, attacking them by shooting into the air, preventing them from rescuing the people in distress. As a result, the Ocean Viking was forced to leave the scene.

🔴Shots fired during rescue operation!

Today we witnessed the attack on the crew of @SOSMedIntl and people in a boat in distress. After a distress call from @alarm_phone, our search plane Seabird, Ocean Viking, and a ship of the so-called Libyan Coast Guard were on the scene. https://t.co/ulW33x447W

We call on #Malta to live up to their responsibility and act immediately to ensure the safety of these people. Lives are at stake.

Our #Seabird reconnaissance aircraft found 17 boats in distress in the central Mediterranean today. Many are built of sheet metal, some of them unable to maneuver without a running engine.
(1/3) https://t.co/GfHbftQ0Tu

In 45 countries in Africa and the Middle East, #LGBTQIA+ people are persecuted. In #Uganda, the law is now being drastically tightened. For many people, the only chance of a free & self-determined life remains the dangerous flight across the central Mediterranean. https://t.co/XigIS9GQbe

(2/2)
Today & every day, we support people affected by racism and fight against racist societal structures. For a world where people do not have to fear violence and discrimination. #InternationalDayAgainstRacism

(1/2)
Daniel*(name changed) talks about the racism he experienced in Libya. Anti-black racism causes exclusion, calculated deaths, murders, and racist police violence worldwide. The list of victims is endless and shows that racism is global and omnipresent. https://t.co/u2n43rwQb1
Let's listen to the people affected and learn how to become active together against #racism - not only today on March 21 but every day.

For decades, activists and survivors of racist violence have been fighting racist structures of oppression and demanding justice. Today, on the International Day against #Racism, we stand in solidarity with all victims of racist violence.

The #EU's racist border regime is killing: More than 331 people have already lost their lives this year in the central Mediterranean. Drowned because Europe didn't want to rescue them. Drowned because they had the supposedly wrong skin color or passport. https://t.co/YRYVqEbrJH

Civil sea rescue is urgently needed in the Central Mediterranean Sea! Our shipyard crew is putting all its energy into the conversion work so that we can soon leave the port of Flensburg with the Sea-Watch 5. Support the work with your donation! https://t.co/oEVY8pHcS6 https://t.co/a6Rc1Ayo4Z
In Tunisia Talks, the #EU must privilege #HumanRights over politics and their interests in migration control now. More info: https://t.co/NNIyN8nM0U
Last week, also the European Parliament voted overwhelmingly in favor of an urgent resolution condemning the crackdown on judicial independence, freedom of expression, and association in #Tunisia.

An open letter of @Amnestyintl, @HRW, @EuroMedRights and @ICJ_org called on @JosepBorrellF and the respective Ministers of Foreign Affairs of all #EU member states to publicly press the Tunisian authorities to reverse their crackdown: https://t.co/UWDIR3to9y

In #Tunesia talks, the #EU has to focus on human rights instead of enhancing further externalization policies, paying Tunisia to seal off EU borders, keep people in overcrowded reception centers, and take over European migration control.
After a hateful speech by president Saied, violence against people of color and migrants escalated in the streets of #Tunis, and numerous people were seriously injured during recent racist attacks.

In the past few weeks, #Tunisia's President Kais Saied's government has rounded up opponents, curbed judicial independence, crushed freedom of expression, and incited hatred against people of color, migrants, and people on the move.

Today is the Foreign Affairs Council meeting, where #EU foreign affairs ministers will discuss the latest violent crackdowns in #Tunisia. Recent #EU statements have failed to acknowledge, let alone condemn, the country's rapidly deteriorating human rights situation.

At least 331 people drowned in the first 76 days of 2023 according to @UNmigration. The European policy of sealing off and blocking civilian #SeaRescue will not lead to fewer people fleeing but to more deaths at Europe's borders. We demand safe and legal routes to Europe now! https://t.co/l7vVp3LJW4

“You have blood on your hands. We do not just demand safe and legal escape routes. We demand that those involved are held accountable for their actions.” - Airborne Tactical Coordinator Samira about the distress case leaving 30 people dead on the weekend: https://t.co/smPBF7g3Mi

Fatal delays: 30 lives lost due to European non-assistance!

Our reconstruction of the incident using original audio of the communications between our aircraft #Seabird, merchant vessels near the boat in distress, as well as Libyan and Italian rescue coordination centers: https://t.co/3GT3i2ZfCi
https://t.co/BElnAHhprv

🔴 Joint statement: Again, 30 people drowned due to deliberate delays in European rescue activity. Only 2 weeks after the politically induced shipwreck off #Crotone. Together with @alarm_phone & @RescueMed, we demand a European sea rescue program & safe migration routes for all. https://t.co/772mMjWDy4

@alarm_phone No rescue is initiated overnight. In the early morning of March 12, the boat of which all the relevant authorities were aware capsizes while the merchant ship FROLAND rescues 17 people. 30 people remain missing. #Italy, #Europe - these deaths are on you.

(8/8)

@alarm_phone At 5.02 pm, we call #Rome again and ask who is now taking responsibility for the rescue. We do not get an answer; the Italian rescue coordination center hangs up. At this point, 47 people are in immediate danger of drowning.

(7/8) https://t.co/pVG2xKoKKi

@alarm_phone At 4.51 pm, we reach someone in #Libya again. We get confirmation: The patrol boats in Benghazi are not equipped for the weather conditions. Libya cannot rescue, will not rescue, and is not coordinating a rescue by the Basilis L merchant ship.

(6/8)

@alarm_phone At the same time, via radio, #Seabird2 reaches the merchant ship Basilis L in the vicinity of the boat in distress. It has already received instructions from #Italy to listen only to the so-called Libyan Coast Guard. We do not learn whether a rescue will be initiated.

(5/8)

@alarm_phone We call the rescue coordination center in Libya. The port authority in Benghazi cannot be reached, and it turns out that so far, neither #Italy nor #Libya is organizing the urgently needed rescue of the 47 people. Italy does not react to this information.

(4/8)

@alarm_phone Immediately two emails are sent to the Italian rescue coordination center in #Rome. As the boat is in the Libyan search and rescue zone, #Italy wants nothing to do with the rescue and refers to the so-called Libyan Coast Guard.

(3/8)

Saturday morning, 10.32 am: 9 hours after @alarm_phone reported the first distress call, our Airborne crew sights the boat with 47 people on board. 2 minutes later, #Seabird2 sends a Mayday Relay to all stations. The coordinates are given. A rescue is urgent.

(2/8)

The boat in distress at sea was known to the authorities and ended deadly. While the Italian government obstructs civil sea rescue, and its own Coast Guard is visibly overwhelmed, distress calls go unanswered. #Italy watched 30 people drown!
A thread

The people must be rescued now before more people die trying to reach safety. Italy and the EU countries must assume responsibility for sea rescue and protect the lives of people on the move. Now, immediately, in this case. In general, in every case.

🔴 Time is running out to rescue ~50 people on board this boat. The distress case is drifting in the high waves. A nearby merchant ship is not equipped for rescues and has been ordered by Italian authorities to wait for the sc. Libyan Coast Guard, but they do not come. https://t.co/5VNPPbcKPk

For three days in a row, our #Airborne crew flew to the maximum and was able to sight 41 boats in distress. With them, overstretching, miscalculations and inaction on the part of the authorities became visible. Our Tactical Coordinator Leona on the situation in the Central Med: https://t.co/SwkJCFPkpb

(3/3) The Tunisian coast guard simultaneously deported people to Tunisia against their will. Italy's racist migration policy is not working – despite blocked sea rescue ships, 1,800 people arrived in #Lampedusa yesterday.

(2/3) Malta does not lift a finger in its own rescue zone. After more than 15 hours and countless calls and radio messages to the rescue coordination center in Rome, the ~50 people are rescued by the 🇮🇹 coast guard during the night. The MARBELLA by their side until the end.

(1/3)🔴Malta calls on merchant vessel not to rescue
17 boats in distress with over 550 people were sighted by our #Seabird yesterday. We informed the merchant vessel MARBELLA of a distress at sea. It wanted to help, but Maltese authorities requested not to intervene.

In the last two days #Seabird sighted 36 boats in distress. The #Italian coast guard has tried to rescue another 7 boats with their already overcrowded boat. Meanwhile, the Italian sea rescue coordination center ignores the support offered by civil sea rescue organizations. https://t.co/NfGJ3BmksH

The #Lampedusa Hotspot needs an internet connection! People on the move need to be able to research their opportunities, develop plans and get in contact with their families and friends! 

Read the joint statement of 11 search and rescue organizations here: https://t.co/dLsKgTik02

With the #Seabird, we have observed misjudgement and excessive demands on the part of the #Italian authorities in the past few days. Now about 500 people have to be rescued immediately! https://t.co/fQRqVanG8r

(3) The situation continues to be unclear, but we estimate over 1,000 people in distress at sea yesterday. It is already known that one of the boats capsized off the coast of #Lampedusa. 20 people could be rescued, for a young woman all help came too late. https://t.co/qNLenWrSlO

(2) A completely overcrowded Italian Coast Guard boat tried to rescue 7 other boats. Assistance offered by Seabird was ignored by the rescue coordination centre. Instead of involving civil rescue vessels, a tanker not designed for rescues was called to assist. https://t.co/jMlvxCQ7ag

(1) Our search plane #Seabird discovered 19 boats in distress yesterday. #Italian authorities have put countless lives at risk due to misjudgement and excessive demands, while civil organizations are prevented from rescuing people for political reasons. https://t.co/ysT3shaEmZ

As a sea rescue organization, we fight against the racist EU border regime. But different forms of discrimination cannot be considered separately. Sea rescue must always be feminist as well. #8M2023

On March 8 - and every day - we fight together against sexism and patriarchy. Instead of pseudo-feminist foreign policy or women's quotas in leadership positions: For radical equality of all (!) genders, without leaving other systems of oppression out of sight. https://t.co/JmiZU2PgKi

@women_in_exile “For the rights of those lucky enough to reach the shores of #FortressEurope. Especially women and children who are more vulnerable to these dangerous journeys.”

.@women_in_exile on #8M2023:

This is nothing new. It is history repeating itself.

Despite all the difficulties, we continue to fight for the right to life. But to save lives in the Mediterranean Sea, we need rescue ships above all. Support us now with a donation to make the #SeaWatch5 ready to rescue as soon as possible: https://t.co/HlelUynAoj

We are working at full speed to get the #SeaWatch5 into operation. Because she is urgently needed: While Italy continues to make sea rescue more difficult by law and block rescue ships, last Sunday at least 68 people drowned off the coast of #Crotone. https://t.co/5Ml2wx0igQ

As civil fleet, we stand united against the criminalization of sea rescue, which leads to even more deaths in the #Mediterranean, and demand the release of the #GeoBarents.

Sea rescue is not a crime!

We stand in #solidarity with the #GeoBarents!
After her last mission, in which 48 people were rescued from distress at sea, the Geo Barents was seized by Italy. @MSF_Sea is now to pay a fine of 10,000 euros due to the new Italian law. https://t.co/0Vs5KPimpL

#Leijtens must now follow up his promises with action. That means ensuring an immediate end to @Frontex operations in the Central Mediterranean.

Our open letter and demands with 19 other organizations: https://t.co/4q3p1Qx2wZ
"I am responsible for the fact that my people don‘t participate in anything called a pushback" said the new @Frontex director #Leijtens before taking office.

As search and rescue NGOs, we demand that @Frontex lives up to #Leijtens alleged three “guiding principles“: “accountability, respect for fundamental rights and transparency“. The first act of #Leijtens should be therefore to terminate Frontex operations in the Central Med.

#Frontex has been involved in countless scandals, trying to hide the agency‘s involvement in countless human rights violations: From #Pushbacks in the Aegean to the coordination of illegal #Pullbacks by the so-called Libyan Coast Guard, to the manipulation of internal reports.

Today, together with 19 civil organizations engaged in Search and Rescue activities, we sent an open letter to the new @Frontex director Hans #Leijtens to live up to his promises. As Leijtens said in a press conference: “There should be absolutely nothing to hide“. https://t.co/bshvChl8vw
We demand immediate clarification of this incident and share our thoughts with the victims’ families during this difficult time.

According to the Commander of the #Crotone Coast Guard, their "patrol boats could have sailed even in force eight seas." So why let unsuitable patrol boats of the financial police intervene that were then forced to return, leaving the people in distress at the mercy of the sea?
The Coast Guard itself, in 2017, acted considering "every overcrowded boat a SAR case in itself“. So who in #Rome was responsible for not giving the order to the #Crotone Coast Guard to take action?

How is it possible that the Italian National Coordination Center (NCC), which is based at the Ministry of Interior, classified the case of a boat with ~200 people on board in a sea with waves up to 2.5 meters, as a "police operation" and not a "Search and Rescue" (SAR) event?

67 bodies recovered, dozens still missing.

The policy of handling boats in distress at sea from a perspective of repression and not rescue, introduced in 2019, led to the worst mass die-off in recent years on the Italian coast on Sunday. #Crotone https://t.co/7fdu0h32mK

A sports hall was turned into a funeral hall for the 66 people who were found dead after the shipwreck in #Crotone.

After the serious shipwreck off Lampedusa in 2013, EU politicians said: "This must never happen again."

Europe, these deaths are yours! https://t.co/PArb3AYgDc

The shipwreck off the Italian coast near Crotone with more than 60 fatalities is the direct consequence of an #EU border policy that forces people onto even longer and more dangerous escape routes.
Our thoughts go out to the relatives and friends who have lost their loved ones. https://t.co/mxxnssXnrm

Another catastrophe at the borders of a European Union that forces people to flee across the sea as a last resort. In mourning for the dead, in thoughts with survivors and relatives. 

Stop the dying. For safe and legal escape routes. https://t.co/087ZiVtUFk

The war of aggression on Ukraine has abruptly turned millions into people on the move. The campaign of @BorderlineEurop shows that legal flight from war & displacement is possible. Must be possible.
Against criminalization - for safe & legal entry routes for all! https://t.co/BlP9o8WbHk

Last Saturday, a woman died there. Not the first in the past months. That this kind of situation keeps happening is no surprise. It’s an intentional political failure of the European Union. https://t.co/yKlZpjSy0s

In the past few days, more than 3,000 people have been in the hotspot on #Lampedusa, which has been set up for 389 people seeking protection. What they need: clean drinking water and medical care. What they get: an overcrowded place and overburdened authorities. https://t.co/BmwAbojvg0

#Seabird2 spotted 2 boats with about 55 people in distress that @alarm_phone already informed authorities about yesterday. Nevertheless, #Malta ordered a nearby vessel not to rescue. Our guests spend days, sometimes weeks, on board during our rescue operations. The weather on the open sea is often rough and cold, and the tent allows us to provide a minimum of protection from it.

Support us now to get the #SeaWatch5 ready to rescue: https://t.co/HlelUynAoj

The reconstruction of our #SeaWatch5 in the shipyard is progressing in big steps. We are covering the entire deck area with a large tent construction. Hundreds of steel struts will later form the roof and walls, allowing us to protect the whole deck from the elements. https://t.co/tP02zJyVsb
The Italian government: working hard to finance and support human rights violations in Libya. https://t.co/e1vqyh39KJ

Our rescue operations take place outside Libyan waters, and as a rule, outside this contiguous zone.

You can find all our #FAQs on our website: https://t.co/ZTkETg6PLH

Civil rescue ships in the central Mediterranean operate in int. waters north of Libya. The territorial waters extend 12 nautical miles off the shoreline. Beyond them lies the so-called contiguous zone up to 24 nm, in which the state has certain rights, e.g., criminal prosecution. https://t.co/mPGnaQBkyG

The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, @volker_turk, joins international condemnation of the Italian government decree, which the Italian parliament voted Wednesday to turn into law. https://t.co/S3zldjtQ7Q

The #EU has over 450 million inhabitants. The arriving people seeking protection thus represent a small percentage of the people living in the EU.
The absolute numbers of arrivals have been steadily decreasing in recent years.

Worldwide 80 million people are displaced. Since 2015, according to official figures, just under 1.9 million people have arrived in Europe by sea. Only a fraction of the people fleeing worldwide seek and find their way to Europe. #FAQs https://t.co/CgLiXrR6vI

While Italy's parliament voted to further restrict civil sea rescue yesterday, at least 73 people have lost their lives in a shipwreck in the Mediterranean.

The #ItalianDecree will ensure that there will be more loss of lives. It is an official incitement to let people drown: https://t.co/zDVxwW3PgO

Our thoughts are with the bereaved, friends, and their families.

As long as there are no safe escape routes from Libya and no effective sea rescue in the Mediterranean, people will continue to die. 

Their deaths could have been avoided.

⚫ The Italian parliament has voted to convert the decree into law.

It is good that German MPs find clear words against the 🇮🇹 decree in the appeal. However, we expect them to also adhere to their own coalition agreement. This means: sea rescue must not be blocked, illegal push- & pullbacks & the suffering at the external borders must be ended!

They "appeal to the 🇮🇹 Parliament to consider, in the context of this vote, the legitimate concerns about the decree’s implications for human lives at sea." - which, consequently, can only mean a rejection as the decree contradicts applicable law and will lead to more deaths. https://t.co/GeCwIJof9e

German MPs from all governing parties have written to the Italian Parliament.

The #EUCO agreed on further isolation, increased cooperation with third countries, full support for #Frontex, & more deportations.
If the #EU wants to preserve even a shred of decency, it should finally take responsibility and focus on human rights instead of violence! https://t.co/XUvX6OeXOZ

The #EU governments must finally take responsibility: Provide safe & legal pathways to Europe, protect human rights, ensure fair asylum procedures and organize the reception of people seeking protection in Europe in solidarity.

More pullbacks, pushbacks, and further militarization of #EU's external borders are a devastating path to take. Since 2016, the #EU has been pursuing a brutal policy of sealing off, which has not solved any of the problems - only increasing the suffering of people on the move.

In the future, the #EU plans to openly cooperate with the so-called Libyan Coast Guard in intercepting people at sea and returning them forcefully back to #Libya. Over 59 million Euros are now on the table to fund illegal and violent #pullbacks.

The EU Commissioner for Human Rights also noted that assigning ever-more distant ports to civil rescue ships "prolongs the suffering of people saved at sea and unduly delays the provision of adequate assistance to meet their basic needs."

In a clear letter of protest the Council of Europe calls upon the Italian government and Interior Minister #Piantedosi to scrap the decree. It violates international maritime law, human rights, and European law: https://t.co/1vTaVfkUIs

The new Italian decree by the far-right government of Giorgia #Meloni not only hinders the rescue of people from distress at sea and will lead to more deaths; it is also illegal.
